info.title: Work Order
info.description: HTTP API for managing work orders and test plans.

post.description:
The `/niworkorder` endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use the equivalent `/niworkitem` endpoint instead.

---

Creates one or more test plans with the provided data.


Note: If `templateId` is specified, the user requires
the privilege to query test plan templates.


The `estimatedDurationInSeconds` specifies only the estimated duration for the work item.
To set the planned duration for the work item, utilize the `schedule-testplans` API.

requestBody.description: The parameters for creating test plans.

200.description: The test plans were partially created.

201.description: The test plans were created successfully.

post.description:
The `/niworkorder` endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use the equivalent `/niworkitem` endpoint instead.

---

Queries test plans with the provided parameters.


Uses the dynamic LINQ `filter` and `substitutions` properties to filter the test plans. These properties are optional.


Uses the `take` and `continuationToken` properties to provide paged responses.


Uses the `orderBy` property to sort the test plans.


Uses the `returnCount` to get the `totalCount` of test plans matching the filter.


Uses the `projection` to only include the specified fields in the response.


Note: The `estimatedDurationInSeconds` returns the planned duration for the work item,
as set through the `schedule-testplans` API.

requestBody.description: The parameters for querying test plans.

200.description: The test plans were queried successfully.

get.description:
The `/niworkorder` endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use the equivalent `/niworkitem` endpoint instead.

---

Get the test plans summary.

200.description: The test plans summary was queried successfully.

get.description:
The `/niworkorder` endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use the equivalent `/niworkitem` endpoint instead.

---

Gets a test plan with the provided ID.


Note: The `estimatedDurationInSeconds` returns the planned duration for the work item,
as set through the `schedule-testplans` API.

parameters.name: testPlanId
parameters.description: Unique ID for the test plan.

parameters.name: executionHistory
parameters.description: The mode for selecting execution history.

schema.description: Defines the mode for selecting execution history in a work order request.

parameters.name: workflow
parameters.description: Include the workflow snapshot in the response.

200.description: The test plan was queried successfully.

post.description:
The `/niworkorder` endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use the equivalent `/niworkitem` endpoint instead.

---

Deletes one or more test plans identified by their IDs.

requestBody.description: The parameters for deleting test plans.

200.description: The test plans were partially deleted.

204.description: The test plans were deleted successfully.

post.description:
The `/niworkorder` endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use the equivalent `/niworkitem` endpoint instead.

---

Updates one or more test plans with the provided data.


Note: Only basic test plan properties can be updated using this API.


The `estimatedDurationInSeconds` specifies only the estimated duration for the work item.
To update scheduling related properties such as `systemId`, `fixtureIds`, `estimatedStartDate`, and `estimatedEndDate`,
as well as the planned duration for the work item, utilize the `schedule-testplans` API.

requestBody.description: The parameters for updating test plans.

200.description: The test plans were partially updated.

post.description:
The `/niworkorder` endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use the equivalent `/niworkitem` endpoint instead.

---

Schedules one or more test plans with the provided data.


Note: Only scheduling related test plan properties can be updated using this API.


The `estimatedDurationInSeconds` specifies the planned duration for the work item.
To update other properties, utilize the `update-testplans` API.

requestBody.description: The parameters for scheduling test plans.

200.description: The test plans were partially scheduled.

post.description:
The `/niworkorder` endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use the equivalent `/niworkitem` endpoint instead.

---

Executes the specified action for the test plan.

Note: START and END actions will always be enabled, even if the action is not defined on the test plan. If no action
is defined for START or END, the default action will be MANUAL.

parameters.name: testPlanId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the test plan the action will be performed on.

requestBody.description: The parameters for executing a test plan action.

200.description: The action was completed successfully.

post.description:
Queries work orders with the provided parameters.


Uses the dynamic LINQ `filter` and `substitutions` properties to filter the work orders. These properties are optional.


Uses the `take` and `continuationToken` properties to provide paged responses.


Uses the `orderBy` property to sort the work orders.


Uses the `returnCount` to get the `totalCount` of work orders matching the filter.


Uses the `projection` to only include the specified fields in the response.

Job.description: Defines a Systems Management Job to be executed by a work item job execution.

jobs.description:
The list of jobs to execute. When the action is executed, all of the jobs will be queued.
If creating any job fails, all jobs will be canceled. If a job fails during execution,
subsequent jobs will still run.

systemId.description: The ID of the system to execute the jobs on instead of the system associated with the work item.

JobExecutionDefinition.description:
Defines a Systems Management Job execution for a work item. This type will trigger a Jobs and
transition the work item state in accordance with the action.

JobExecutionEvent.description: An event tracking a job execution triggered from a work item.

JobExecutionResult.description: Result of executing a NationalInstruments.WorkItem.Model.Api.V1.ExecutionType.Job work item action.

ManualExecutionDefinition.description:
Defines a manual execution for a work item. This type will not trigger an execution, but will
transition the work item state in accordance with the action.

ManualExecutionEvent.description: An event tracking a manual execution triggered from a work item.

ManualExecutionResult.description: Result of executing a manual work item action.

NoneExecutionDefinition.description: Defines an unimplemented execution for a work item. This type will not trigger an execution or transition the work item state.

notebookId.description: The ID of the notebook to execute.

parameters.description: Dictionary of parameters that will be passed to the notebook when the execution is run.

NotebookExecutionDefinition.description:
Defines a notebook execution for a work item. This type will trigger a notebook execution, and
transition the work item state in accordance with the action.

executionId.description: The ID of the triggered execution

NotebookExecutionEvent.description: An event tracking a notebook execution triggered from a work item.

NotebookExecutionResult.description: Result of executing a notebook work item action.

available.description: Whether the operation is available to the caller

workOrderName.description: Name of the work order to which the test plan is linked.

filter.description:
The test plan template query filter in [dynamic LINQ](https://github.com/ni/systemlink-OpenAPI-documents/wiki/Dynamic-Linq-Query-Language) format.

            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y' or 'x == y'.
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'.
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'.
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'.
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'.
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'.
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y' or 'x && y'.
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y' or 'x || y'.
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(\"y\")'.
- Does not contain operator '!x.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(\"y\")'.
            
Allowed properties in the filter are:

- `id`: String representing the ID of a test plan template. The value must be a numeric string. Field supports only equals '=' and not equal '!=' operators for filtering.

- `productFamilies`: Array of strings representing the product families to which the test plan template belongs.

- `partNumbers`: Array of strings representing the part numbers of the products to which the test plan template belongs.

- `fileIds`: The array of file IDs associated with the test plan template.

- `name`: String representing the name of a test plan template.

- `summary`: String representing the summary of a test plan template.

- `description`: String representing description of the test plan created from this template.

- `templateGroup`: String representing the template group defined by the user.

- `testProgram`: String representing the test program name of the test plan created from this template.

- `systemFilter`: String representing the LINQ filter used to filter the potential list of systems capable of executing test plans created from this template.

- `dutFilter`: String representing the LINQ filter used to filter the potential list of DUTs capable of executing test plans created from this template.

- `workspace`: String representing the workspace where the test plan template belongs.

- `createdBy`: String representing the user who created the test plan template.

- `updatedBy`: String representing the user who updated the test plan template.

- `createdAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the test plan template was created.

- `updatedAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the test plan template was most recently updated.

- `properties`: Collection of key-value pairs related to a test plan created from this template. Example: properties.Any(key == \"Location\" & value == \"Austin\")
- `workflowId`: String representing the ID of the workflow associated with the test plan template.

substitutions.description:
Makes substitutions in the query filter expression using non-negative integers. These integers use the
`@` symbol as a prefix. The filter expression replaces each substitution with the element at the corresponding
index in this list. The index is zero-based. For example, an element at the zeroth index of the substitutions
list replaces `@0` in the filter expression.

take.description: The maximum number of test plan templates to return.

orderBy.description: Field by which test plan templates can be ordered/sorted.

descending.description: Whether to return the test plan templates in the descending order. By default, test plan templates are sorted in the ascending order.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching test plan templates. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of test plan templates, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
test plan templates, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

projection.description:
Specifies the fields to include with the returned test plan templates.
If you do not specify a value, all fields are included.

QueryTestPlanTemplatesRequest.description: Request information for the query test plan templates API.

testPlanTemplates.description: List of queried test plan templates.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching test plan templates. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of test plan templates, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
testplan templates, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

QueryTestPlanTemplatesResponse.description: Response information for the query test plan templates API.

filter.description:
The test plan query filter in [Dynamic Linq](https://github.com/ni/systemlink-OpenAPI-documents/wiki/Dynamic-Linq-Query-Language) format.

            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y' or 'x == y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y' or 'x && y'
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y' or 'x || y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(\"y\")'
- Does not contain operator '!.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(\"y\")'
            
Allowed properties in the filter are:

- `id`: String representing the ID of a test plan. The value must be a numeric string. Field supports only equals '=' and not equal '!=' operators for filtering.

- `templateId` The ID of the test plan template used to create this test plan. The value must be a numeric string.

- `name`: String representing the name of a test plan.

- `state`: String enumeration representing the state of the test plan. Possible values are: New, Defined, Reviewed, Scheduled, InProgress, PendingApproval, Closed, Canceled.

- `description`: String representing details of a test plan.

- `assignedTo`: String representing the user to whom the test plan is assigned.

- `workOrderId`: String representing the ID of the work order with which the test plan is linked. The value must be a numeric string.

- `partNumber`: String representing the part number of the product for which the test is planned.

- `dutId`: String representing the ID of the asset for which the test is planned.

- `dutSerialNumber`: String representing the serial number of the asset for which the test is planned.

- `testProgram`: String representing the Name of the planned test program.

- `systemFilter`: String representing the LINQ filter used to filter the potential list of systems capable of executing test plans.

- `dutFilter`: String representing the LINQ filter used to filter the potential list of DUTs capable of executing test plans.

- `systemId`: String representing the ID of the system where the test is planned.

- `fixtureIds`: The array of fixture IDs (asset IDs) where the test is planned.

- `plannedStartDateTime`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the test plan will be started.

- `estimatedEndDateTime`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the test plan will be completed.

- `EstimatedDurationInSeconds`: Integer representing the estimated time in seconds for the test plan to be executed.

- `workspace`: String representing the workspace where the test plan belongs.

- `fileIdsFromTemplate`: The array of file IDs from the template linked to the test plan.

- `createdBy`: String representing the user who created the test plan.

- `updatedBy`: String representing the user who updated the test plan.

- `createdAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the test plan was created.

- `updatedAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the test plan was most recently updated.

- `properties`: Collection of key-value pairs related to a test plan. Example: properties.Any(key == \"Location\" & value == \"Austin\")
- `dashboard`: String representing the ID for the dashboard associated with this test plan. Example: dashboard.Id == \"1234\"

- `workflowId`: String representing the workflow ID for the test plan.

substitutions.description:
Makes substitutions in the query filter expression using non-negative integers. These integers use the
`@` symbol as a prefix. The filter expression replaces each substitution with the element at the corresponding
index in this list. The index is zero-based. For example, an element at the zeroth index of the substitutions
list replaces `@0` in the filter expression.

take.description: The maximum number of test plans to return.

orderBy.description: Field by which test plans can be ordered/sorted.

descending.description:
Whether to return the test plans in the descending order. By default, test plans are sorted
in the ascending order.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching test plans. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of test plans, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
test plans, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

returnCount.description: Whether to return the total number of test plans which match the provided filter, disregarding the take value.

projection.description:
Specifies the fields to include with the returned test plans.
If you do not specify a value, all fields are included.

QueryTestPlansRequest.description: Request information for the query test plans API.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching test plans. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of test plans, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
test plans, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

totalCount.description: The total number of test plans which match the provided filter, disregarding the take value. The `TotalCount` will be added to the response only if the `ReturnCount` is set to `true` in the request.

QueryTestPlansResponse.description: Response information for the query test plans API.

filter.description:
The work order query filter in [Dynamic Linq](https://github.com/ni/systemlink-OpenAPI-documents/wiki/Dynamic-Linq-Query-Language) format.

            
Operators:
- Equals operator '='. Example: 'x = y' or 'x == y'
- Not equal operator '!='. Example: 'x != y'
- Greater than operator '>'. Example: 'x > y'
- Greater than or equal operator '>='. Example: 'x >= y'
- Less than operator '<'. Example: 'x < y'
- Less than or equal operator '<='. Example: 'x <= y'
- Logical AND operator 'and'. Example: 'x and y' or 'x && y'
- Logical OR operator 'or'. Example: 'x or y' or 'x || y'
- Contains operator '.Contains()', used to check whether a string contains another string. Example: 'x.Contains(\"y\")'
- Does not contain operator '!x.Contains()', used to check whether a string does not contain another string. Example: '!x.Contains(\"y\")'
            
Allowed properties in the filter are:

- `id`: String representing the ID of a work order. The value must be a numeric string. Field supports only equals '=' and not equal '!=' operators for filtering.

- `name`: String representing the name of a work order.

- `type`: String enumeration representing the type of the work order. Possible values are : TestRequest
- `state`: String enumeration representing the state of the work order. Possible values are: New, Defined, Reviewed, Scheduled, InProgress, PendingApproval, Closed, Canceled.

- `description`: String representing details of a work order.

- `assignedTo`: String representing the user to whom the work order is assigned.

- `workspace`: String representing the workspace where the work order belongs.

- `requestedBy`: String representing the user who requested the work order.

- `createdBy`: String representing the user who created the work order.

- `updatedBy`: String representing the user who updated the work order.

- `createdAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the work order was created.

- `updatedAt`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the work order was most recently updated.

- `earliestStartDate`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating from when the work order can be started.

- `dueDate`: ISO-8601 formatted timestamp indicating when the work order has to be completed.

- `properties`: Collection of key-value pairs related to a work order. Example: properties.Any(key == \"Location\" & value == \"Austin\")

substitutions.description:
Makes substitutions in the query filter expression using non-negative integers. These integers use the
`@` symbol as a prefix. The filter expression replaces each substitution with the element at the corresponding
index in this list. The index is zero-based. For example, an element at the zeroth index of the substitutions
list replaces `@0` in the filter expression.

take.description: The maximum number of work orders to return.

orderBy.description: Field by which work order can be ordered/sorted.

descending.description:
Whether to return the work orders in the descending order. By default, work orders are sorted
in the ascending order.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching work orders. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of work orders, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
work orders, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

returnCount.description: Whether to return the total number of work orders which match the provided filter, disregarding the take value.

projection.description:
Specifies the fields to include with the returned work orders.
If you do not specify a value, all fields are included.

QueryWorkOrdersRequest.description: Request information for the query work orders API

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next item in the matching work orders. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of work orders, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token. To paginate
work orders, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

totalCount.description: The total number of work orders which match the provided filter, disregarding the take value. The `TotalCount` will be added to the response only if the `ReturnCount` is set to `true` in the request.

QueryWorkOrdersResponse.description: Response information for the query work orders API.

take.description: The maximum number of workflows to return.

continuationToken.description:
A token that allows the user to resume a query at the next workflow. When querying, a token will be returned if a query may be continued.
To obtain the next page of workflows, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token.
To paginate workflows, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.

To obtain the next page of workflows, pass the token to the service on a subsequent request. The service will respond with a new continuation token.
To paginate workflows, continue sending requests with the newest continuation token provided by the service until this value is null.
